alert.note: Alert for Central Oregon Coast; North Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued April 03 at 12:39PM PDT until April 04 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 PM PDT MONDAY NEAR BEACHES AND HEADLANDS... * WHAT...Southwest winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts between 50 to 65 mph expected. * WHERE...In Oregon, North Oregon Coast and Central Oregon Coast. In Washington, South Washington Coast. * WHEN...From 11 PM this evening to 11 PM PDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines. Power outages are possible, but should remain rather isolated. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The strongest winds are expected between 12 AM and 8 AM PDT Monday. After 8 AM Monday, high winds will become more localized and will be associated with the strongest showers or thunderstorms.
info.instruction: People should avoid being outside in forested areas and around trees and branches. If possible, remain in the lower levels of your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Use caution if you must drive.

area.areaDesc: Central Oregon Coast; North Oregon Coast
